solution_line_template: One pack of chips is {chip_price_increase_percentage} * {pretzel_cost_per_pack} = ${<<{chip_price_increase_percentage}*{pretzel_cost_per_pack}={additional_chip_cost}>>}{additional_chip_cost} more expensive than a pack of pretzels.
That means one pack of chips costs {pretzel_cost_per_pack} + {additional_chip_cost} = ${<<{pretzel_cost_per_pack}+{additional_chip_cost}={chip_cost_per_pack}>>}{chip_cost_per_pack}
So Maciek paid {pretzel_cost_per_pack} * {num_pretzel_packs} = ${<<{pretzel_cost_per_pack}*{num_pretzel_packs}={total_pretzel_cost}>>}{total_pretzel_cost} for the pretzels
He also paid {chip_cost_per_pack} * {num_chip_packs} = ${<<{chip_cost_per_pack}*{num_chip_packs}={total_chip_cost}>>}{total_chip_cost} for the chips.
In total Maciek paid {total_pretzel_cost} + {total_chip_cost} = ${<<{total_pretzel_cost}+{total_chip_cost}={total_cost}>>}{total_cost} for his purchases.
